AddUsersForUserManager.document: This API is used to add user lists (user management).
AddUsersForUserManager.name: Adds user lists (user management)

CreateInstance.document: This API is used to create an EMR cluster instance.
CreateInstance.name: Creates EMR instance

DescribeClusterNodes.document: This API is used to query the information of a hardware node.
DescribeClusterNodes.name: Queries hardware node information

DescribeInstances.document: This API is used to query EMR instances.
DescribeInstances.name: Queries EMR instances

DescribeInstancesList.document: This API is used to query EMR cluster instances.
DescribeInstancesList.name: Queries EMR cluster instances

DescribeResourceSchedule.document: This API is used to get data from the YARN Resource Scheduling page.
DescribeResourceSchedule.name: Gets data from the YARN Resource Scheduling page

DescribeUsersForUserManager.document: This API is used to export users in batches.
DescribeUsersForUserManager.name: Queries the user list (user management)

InquiryPriceCreateInstance.document: This API is used to query price of instance creation.
InquiryPriceCreateInstance.name: Queries price of instance creation

InquiryPriceRenewInstance.document: This API is used to query the price for renewal.
InquiryPriceRenewInstance.name: Queries the price for renewal

InquiryPriceUpdateInstance.document: This API is used to query price of scaling.
InquiryPriceUpdateInstance.name: Queries price of scaling

ModifyResourceScheduleConfig.document: This API is used to modify the resource configuration of YARN Resource Scheduling.
ModifyResourceScheduleConfig.name: Modifies the resource configuration of YARN Resource Scheduling

ModifyResourceScheduler.document: This API is used to modify the YARN resource scheduler (the change will take effect after you click Apply).
ModifyResourceScheduler.name: Modifies the YARN resource scheduler

TerminateTasks.document: This API is used to terminate a task node.
TerminateTasks.name: Terminates a task node

members.document:
Instance status code. Value range:
  • 2: cluster running
  • 3: creating cluster.
  • 4: scaling out cluster.
  • 5: adding router node in cluster.
  • 6: installing component in cluster.
  • 7: cluster executing command.
  • 8: restarting service.
  • 9: entering maintenance.
  • 10: suspending service.
  • 11: exiting maintenance.
  • 12: exiting suspension.
  • 13: delivering configuration.
  • 14: terminating cluster.
  • 15: terminating core node.
  • 16: terminating task node.
  • 17: terminating router node.
  • 18: changing webproxy password.
  • 19: isolating cluster.
  • 20: resuming cluster.
  • 21: repossessing cluster.
  • 22: waiting for configuration adjustment.
  • 23: cluster isolated.
  • 24: removing node.
  • 33: waiting for refund.
  • 34: refunded.
  • 301: creation failed.
  • 302: scale-out failed.
    • Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Status

members.document:
Product ID. Different product IDs represent different EMR product versions. Valid values:
  • 1: EMR v1.3.1
  • 2: EMR v2.0.1
  • 4: EMR v2.1.0
  • 7: EMR v3.0.0
  • 9: EMR v2.2.0
  • 11: ClickHouse v1.0.0
  • 13: Druid v1.0.0
  • 15: EMR v2.2.1
  • 16: EMR v2.3.0
  • 17: ClickHouse v1.1.0
  • 19: EMR v2.4.0
  • 20: EMR v2.5.0
  • 22: ClickHouse v1.2.0
  • 24: EMR TianQiong v1.0.0
  • 25: EMR v3.1.0
  • 26: Doris v1.0.0
  • 27: Kafka v1.0.0
  • 28: EMR v3.2.0
  • 29: EMR v2.5.1
  • 30: EMR v2.6.0
members.name: ProductId

members.document:
List of deployed components. The list of component options varies by EMR product ID (i.e., `ProductId`; for specific meanings, please see the `ProductId` input parameter). For more information, please see [Component Version](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/589/20279?from_cn_redirect=1).
Enter an instance value: `hive` or `flink`.
members.name: Software

members.document:
Whether to enable high node availability. Valid values:
  • 0: does not enable high availability of node.
  • 1: enables high availability of node.
members.name: SupportHA

members.document:
Instance name.
  • Length limit: 6-36 characters.
  • Only letters, numbers, dashes (-), and underscores (_) are supported.
members.name: InstanceName

members.document:
Instance billing mode. Valid values:
  • 0: pay-as-you-go.
members.name: PayMode

members.document:
Purchase duration of instance, which needs to be used together with `TimeUnit`.
  • When `TimeUnit` is `s`, this parameter can only be filled with 3600, indicating a pay-as-you-go instance.
  • When `TimeUnit` is `m`, the number entered in this parameter indicates the purchase duration of the monthly-subscription instance; for example, 1 means one month
members.name: TimeSpan

members.document:
Time unit of instance purchase duration. Valid values:
  • s: seconds. When `PayMode` is 0, `TimeUnit` can only be `s`.
  • m: month. When `PayMode` is 1, `TimeUnit` can only be `m`.
members.name: TimeUnit

members.document:
Instance login settings. This parameter allows you to set the login password or key for your purchased node.
  • If the key is set, the password will be only used for login to the native component WebUI.
  • If the key is not set, the password will be used for login to all purchased nodes and the native component WebUI.
members.name: LoginSettings

members.document: Configuration information of VPC. This parameter is used to specify the VPC ID, subnet ID, etc.
members.name: VPCSettings

members.document: Node resource specification.
members.name: ResourceSpec

members.document: Parameter required for enabling COS access.
members.name: COSSettings

members.document: Instance location. This parameter is used to specify the AZ, project, and other attributes of the instance.
members.name: Placement

members.document: Security group to which an instance belongs in the format of `sg-xxxxxxxx`. This parameter can be obtained from the `SecurityGroupId` field in the return value of the [DescribeSecurityGroups](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/api/215/15808) API.
members.name: SgId

members.document: [Bootstrap action](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/589/35656?from_cn_redirect=1) script settings
members.name: PreExecutedFileSettings

members.document:
Whether auto-renewal is enabled. Valid values:
  • 0: auto-renewal not enabled.
  • 1: auto-renewal enabled.
members.name: AutoRenew

members.document: Client token.
members.name: ClientToken

members.document:
Whether to enable public IP access for master node. Valid values:
  • NEED_MASTER_WAN: enables public IP for master node.
  • NOT_NEED_MASTER_WAN: does not enable.
    • Public IP is enabled for master node by default.
members.name: NeedMasterWan

members.document: Whether to enable remote public network login, i.e., port 22. When `SgId` is not empty, this parameter does not take effect.
members.name: RemoteLoginAtCreate

members.document: Whether to enable secure cluster. 0: no; other values: yes.
members.name: CheckSecurity

members.document: Accesses to external file system.
members.name: ExtendFsField

members.document: Tag description list. This parameter is used to bind a tag to a resource instance.
members.name: Tags

members.document:
List of spread placement group IDs. Only one can be specified currently.
This parameter can be obtained in the `SecurityGroupId` field in the return value of the [DescribeSecurityGroups](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/213/15486?from_cn_redirect=1) API.
members.name: DisasterRecoverGroupIds

members.document: CBS disk encryption at the cluster level. 0: not encrypted, 1: encrypted
members.name: CbsEncrypt

members.document:
Hive-shared metadatabase type. Valid values:
  • EMR_DEFAULT_META: the cluster creates one by default.
  • EMR_EXIST_META: the cluster uses the specified EMR-MetaDB instance.
  • USER_CUSTOM_META: the cluster uses a custom MetaDB instance.
members.name: MetaType

members.document: EMR-MetaDB instance
members.name: UnifyMetaInstanceId

members.document: Custom MetaDB instance information
members.name: MetaDBInfo

members.document: Custom application role.
members.name: ApplicationRole

members.document:
Scenario-based values:
Hadoop-Kudu
Hadoop-Zookeeper
Hadoop-Presto
Hadoop-Hbase
members.name: SceneName

members.document: Shared component information
members.name: ExternalService

members.document: `true` indicates that the multi-AZ deployment mode is enabled. This parameter is available only in cluster creation and cannot be changed after setting.
members.name: MultiZone

members.document: Node resource specs. The actual number of AZs is set, with the first AZ as the primary AZ, the second as the backup AZ, and the third as the arbitrator AZ. If the multi-AZ mode is not enabled, set the value to `1`.
members.name: MultiZoneSettings

members.document:
Instance ID
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: JDBC connection to custom MetaDB instance beginning with `jdbc:mysql://`
members.name: MetaDataJdbcUrl

members.document: Custom MetaDB instance username
members.name: MetaDataUser

members.document: Custom MetaDB instance password
members.name: MetaDataPass

members.document: Custom parameter key
members.name: Name

members.document: Custom parameter value
members.name: Value

members.document: Cluster instance ID in the format of emr-xxxxxxxx
members.name: InstanceId

members.document:
Node flag. Valid values:
  • all: gets the information of nodes in all types except TencentDB information.
  • master: gets master node information.
  • core: gets core node information.
  • task: gets task node information.
  • common: gets common node information.
  • router: gets router node information.
  • db: gets TencentDB information in normal status.
    • Note: only the above values are supported for the time being. Entering other values will cause errors.
members.name: NodeFlag

members.document: Page number. Default value: 0, indicating the first page.
members.name: Offset

members.document: Number of returned results per page. Default value: 100. Maximum value: 100
members.name: Limit

members.document: Resource type. Valid values: all, host, pod. Default value: all
members.name: HardwareResourceType

members.document: Searchable field
members.name: SearchFields

members.document: Total number of queried nodes
members.name: TotalCnt

members.document:
List of node details
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: NodeList

members.document:
List of tag keys owned by user
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TagKeys

members.document:
Resource type list
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: HardwareResourceTypeList

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
Cluster filtering policy. Valid values:
  • clusterList: Queries the list of clusters excluding terminated ones.
  • monitorManage: Queries the list of clusters excluding those terminated, under creation and not successfully created.
  • cloudHardwareManage/componentManage: Two reserved values, which have the same implications as those of `monitorManage`.
members.name: DisplayStrategy

members.document: Page number. Default value: `0`, indicating the first page.
members.name: Offset

members.document: Number of returned results per page. Default value: `10`; maximum value: `100`.
members.name: Limit

members.document:
Sorting field. Valid values:
  • clusterId: Sorting by instance ID.
  • addTime: Sorting by instance creation time.
  • status: Sorting by instance status code.
members.name: OrderField

members.document:
Sort ascending or descending based on `OrderField`. Valid values:
  • 0: Descending.
  • 1: Ascending.
    • Default value: `0`.
members.name: Asc

members.document: Custom query
members.name: Filters

members.document: Number of eligible instances.
members.name: TotalCnt

members.document: Cluster instance list.
members.name: InstancesList

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
Cluster filtering policy. Valid values:
  • clusterList: queries the list of clusters except terminated ones.
  • monitorManage: queries the list of clusters except those that have been terminated, are being created, or failed to be created.
  • cloudHardwareManage/componentManage: reserved fields with the same meaning as `monitorManage`.
members.name: DisplayStrategy

members.document: Queries by one or more instance IDs in the format of `emr-xxxxxxxx`. For the format of this parameter, please see the `id.N` section in [API Overview](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/api/213/15688). If no instance ID is entered, the list of all instances under this `APPID` will be returned.
members.name: InstanceIds

members.document: Page number. Default value: 0, indicating the first page.
members.name: Offset

members.document: Number of returned results per page. Default value: 10. Maximum value: 100
members.name: Limit

members.document: ID of the project to which the instance belongs. This parameter can be obtained from the `projectId` field in the return value of the `DescribeProject` API. If this value is -1, the list of all instances will be returned.
members.name: ProjectId

members.document:
Sorting field. Valid values:
  • clusterId: sorts by cluster ID.
  • addTime: sorts by instance creation time.
  • status: sorts by instance status code.
members.name: OrderField

members.document:
Sorts according to `OrderField` in ascending or descending order. Valid values:
  • 0: descending order.
  • 1: ascending order.
    • Default value: 0.
members.name: Asc

members.document: Number of eligible instances.
members.name: TotalCnt

List of EMR instance details.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

List of tag keys associated to an instance.

members.document:
Time unit of instance purchase duration. Valid values:
  • s: seconds. When `PayMode` is 0, `TimeUnit` can only be `s`.
members.name: TimeUnit

members.document:
Purchase duration of instance, which needs to be used together with `TimeUnit`.
  • When `TimeUnit` is `s`, this parameter can only be filled with 3600, indicating a pay-as-you-go instance.
  • When `TimeUnit` is `m`, the number entered in this parameter indicates the purchase duration of the monthly-subscription instance; for example, 1 means one month
members.name: TimeSpan

members.document: Currency.
members.name: Currency

members.document:
Instance billing mode. Valid values:
  • 0: pay-as-you-go.
members.name: PayMode

members.document:
Whether to enable high availability of node. Valid values:
  • 0: does not enable high availability of node.
  • 1: enables high availability of node.
members.name: SupportHA

members.document:
List of deployed components. Different required components need to be selected for different EMR product IDs (i.e., `ProductId`; for specific meanings, please see the `ProductId` field in the input parameter):
  • When `ProductId` is 1, the required components include hadoop-2.7.3, knox-1.2.0, and zookeeper-3.4.9
  • When `ProductId` is 2, the required components include hadoop-2.7.3, knox-1.2.0, and zookeeper-3.4.9
  • When `ProductId` is 4, the required components include hadoop-2.8.4, knox-1.2.0, and zookeeper-3.4.9
  • When `ProductId` is 7, the required components include hadoop-3.1.2, knox-1.2.0, and zookeeper-3.4.9
members.name: Software

members.document: Node specification queried for price.
members.name: ResourceSpec

members.document: Instance location. This parameter is used to specify the AZ, project, and other attributes of the instance.

members.document:
Hive-shared metadatabase type. Valid values:
  • EMR_DEFAULT_META: the cluster creates one by default.
  • EMR_EXIST_META: the cluster uses the specified EMR-MetaDB instance.
  • USER_CUSTOM_META: the cluster uses a custom MetaDB instance.
members.name: MetaType

  • 7: EMR v3.0.0.
